programme.desc: A city slicker moves his family to the country with disastrous results.

programme.title: Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes
programme.desc: A jungle man is raised from infancy by apes in this wild adventure.

programme.title: Ghosts of Mississippi
programme.desc: A district attorney reopens the case against the murderer of Medgar Evers.

programme.title: Arthur (1981)
programme.desc: A drunken playboy decides to give up his inheritance for true love.

programme.title: Message in a Bottle
programme.desc: A lonely woman's discovery of a man's letter in a bottle leads to love.

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: An apartment superintendent discovers a creature in the complex's pool.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Sent to spend the summer on a remote and mysterious island, brothers embark on a thrilling treasure hunt to restore their family's lost fortune.

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man before it is too late.

programme.title: Stealing Harvard
programme.desc: A home health-care exec under the thumb of his fiancée’s father is forced into petty crime to finance his niece's first year in the Ivy Leagues.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Wings of Courage
programme.desc: The film tells the dramatic story of three legendary French aviators and the first historic airmail flights in the Andes. It combines a tale of high adventure and excitement with cutting-edge technology, and is the fulfillment of one of Annaud's long-held dreams.

programme.title: All the Pretty Horses
programme.desc: The dreams of an American wanting to live the cowboy way in Mexico become a web of murder and betrayal when he falls for a powerful man’s daughter.

programme.title: The Broken Hearts Club: A Romantic Comedy
programme.desc: A group of gay friends in Los Angeles share the ups and downs of relationships, careers, fatherhood, the deaths of friends, and new beginnings.

programme.title: Kabluey
programme.desc: To keep his brother’s family together during his deployment in Iraq, slacker Uncle Salman takes a humiliating job as a giant corporate mascot.

programme.title: About Last Night...
programme.desc: After Danny and his new girlfriend Debbie move in together, the two are bombarded with advice from their disapproving pals, Bernie and Joan.

programme.title: My Mom's New Boyfriend
programme.desc: An FBI agent discovers more than he wanted to about his mom when he is ordered to spy on her new boyfriend, a suspect in an art theft investigation.

programme.title: Untraceable
programme.desc: There has never been a cyber criminal they couldn't catch...until now...The more people who watch...the faster the victims die.

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: Feeling responsible for his father's death, which occurred during a climbing expedition, Peter Garrett (Chris O'Donnell) has quit the pursuit in favor of photography, while his sister, Annie (Robin Tunney), has become a top climber. After Annie is hired by wealthy businessman Elliot Vaughn (Bill Paxton) to lead a trek, inclement weather causes the crew to become trapped. Facing his fears, Peter assembles a rescue team, including experienced climber Montgomery Wick (Scott Glenn), to save them.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Ike : Countdown to D-Day
programme.desc: This film is the story of two great military men, their relationship, and the plotting of the global offensive, which turned the tide of World War II.

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: A talented, but temperamental and womanizing actor, who has antagonized every producer in NYC, needs money and plays the unlikely role of a lifetime.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: In the future, a corporation has begun illegally cloning humans. They mistakenly clone the wrong man, who is now the only one who could expose them.

programme.title: Air Force One
programme.desc: Harrison Ford portrays a Vietnam vet and U.S President whose Air Force One flight with the First Family is hijacked by a terrorist bent on revenge.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A big-hearted, working class teenager must overcome the odds in order to fulfill his dreams of playing football for Notre Dame.

programme.title: The Harder They Fall
programme.desc: Broke and without work, newspaper reporter Eddie Willis (Humphrey Bogart) agrees to work for the corrupt boxing promoter Nick Benko (Rod Steiger) to help hype his new boxer, Toro Moreno (Mike Lane). While Toro is beastly in appearance, he has no actual boxing talent, and all his fights are fixed. When Toro gets a shot at the title against the brutal Buddy Brannen (Max Baer), Willis is faced with the tough decision of whether or not to tell Toro that his entire career is a sham.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: The Jolson Story
programme.desc: At the turn of the 20th century, young Asa Yoelson (Scotty Beckett) decides to go against the wishes of his cantor father (Ludwig Donath) and pursue a career in show business. Gradually working his way up through the vaudeville ranks, Asa -- now calling himself Al Jolson (Larry Parks) -- joins a blackface minstrel troupe and soon builds a reputation as a consummate performer. But as his career grows in size, so does his ego, resulting in battles in business as well as in his personal life.

programme.title: The Game That Kills
programme.desc: A man infiltrates a hockey team to investigate the death of his brother, the team's star left wing.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger's uncanny resemblance to a wanted outlaw results in his own arrest by a fellow lawman.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: South of Death Valley
programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to ease tensions between ranchers and miners over the cause of polluted water.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Fury at Gunsight Pass
programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Secret Patrol
programme.desc: A Mountie (Charles Starrett) works under cover to solve the murder of his best friend.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: Montana (1950)
programme.desc: An Australian gets caught in the battle between ranchers and sheep men.

programme.title: Treasure Island
programme.desc: Robert Louis Stevenson's tale of a boy out to find a buried treasure.

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.title: The Betsy
programme.desc: Power, greed and sex drive a family's car manufacturing dynasty.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Boys Town

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: Fugitives risk their lives to bring a baby out of the desert to safety.

programme.title: Doctor X
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a series of cannibalistic murders at a college.

programme.title: She
programme.desc: Explorers uncover a lost kingdom ruled by an immortal queen.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Horror of Dracula
programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The skull of a promising young dancer is discovered at a construction site; Hannah's safety is jeopardized when an assignment takes her to a dangerous part of town.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Human remains from a 150-year-old slave ship surface; the investigation leads Booth and Brennan to a cruise where a murder victim was seen moments before his death.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: An event for a candymaker (Wayne Knight) turns bitter when human remains are discovered in the world's largest chocolate bar; Cam struggles with her daughter's decision to attend a college that fails to meet her high standards.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate a crime scene where a human carcass has melted to the dashboard of a charred truck; Sweets tries to keep his feelings for Daisy from interfering while helping her pass a government psychological evaluation.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A brilliant and career-driven surgeon is found dead in a rough neighborhood; a new friend helps Brennan make a discovery about herself.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: The team must find a treasure in order to solve the murder of a man responsible for a coin heist.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a cooking show contestant, poisoned on live television.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of a billionaire playboy, Toby's curiosities about his family arise.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: After being drugged, Toby is implicated in an armed kidnapping.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The members of the BAU team are brought back to their origins as they look at one of Gideon and Rossi's old cases.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a hero emerges from the wreckage of an explosion in Indianapolis, the BAU team members must protect him as they try to identify the person responsible before more bombings occur.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The members of the BAU team search for a suspect who may have witnessed abuse as a child; Kate is worried when her niece and a friend make plans with a boy they met online.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When two guards at a maximum security prison are murdered, the BAU team thinks one or more people within the prison walls may be responsible.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tracks a serial killer in Wisconsin; Kate is faced with trouble when her niece, Meg, starts acting out.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When an up-and-coming congressman's wife disappears, the team investigates his political enemies as potential suspects.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: International Unit Chief Jack Garrett (Gary Sinise) and his team requires assistance from the BAU when a family of four is abducted during their Barbados vacation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the members of a family are found murdered at their dining room table, the team looks for secrets in their past; Hotch tries to make peace with his father-in-law (Ed Asner).

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When three alleged murderers claim that they were attacked by a monster at the moment of the crimes, the BAU searches for a suspect who controls minds; the hunt puts one team member in danger.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tracks a vigilante in Los Angeles who is shooting people with possible ties to criminal activity.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team suspects Kate's niece and her friend were kidnapped by an online predator involved in sex trafficking and race to find them before they are hurt.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU interviews candidates to take the opening left by Kate's departure; the team tracks a serial killer who leaves behind evidence that indicates a person intent on revenge.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team must find the person responsible for a sarin gas attack on a Los Angeles bus before a larger incident occurs.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team suspects a jilted unknown subject is responsible when brides are murdered on the eve of their nuptials.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a robbery-homicide leaves three restaurant employees dead, a cold case that occurred in the same town six years earlier could yield a lead.

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A murder in a Florida community of sex offenders results in a large number of possible suspects; a career opportunity could take Lewis away from the BAU.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Rossi's daughter, a journalist, investigates the disappearance of a college student; JJ comes back from maternity leave.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: An unknown subject in Phoenix abducts people and deprives them of sleep; Garcia and Hotch deal with a threat from hit men.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU works with the NSA when two undercover DEA agents are murdered and another goes missing; Hotch hopes the team's work with the NSA will bring them closer to finding a ring of hit men.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Murdoc abducts MacGyver's girlfriend to force Mac to help him rescue his son from a kidnapper; a dangerous person from Murdoc's personal life shows up, giving Mac a glimpse into the villain's past.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Matty sends the team to Ghana to recover a hard drive from an e-waste landfill that is run by a powerful and violent man, leading them to speculate about what could be on the device.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: An Irish military intelligence officer claims to know the whereabouts of a lethal bomb maker whom Mac has been hunting for years.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When a vial containing a deadly virus is stolen from the Center for Disease Control in Atlanta, MacGvyer and team race to recover it before the thief unleashes a global pandemic.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Matty reveals the shocking secret that her husband has been undercover in a criminal organization for eight years; when his status as a CIA agent comes out, Matty needs MacGyver to find and extract her husband before it's too late.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Jack's mini-vacation is cut short when someone from their past abducts them and locks them in a concrete room; Matty tasks Riley, Bozer and Leanna with stealing a diamond encoded with terrorist intelligence from a princess in Milan.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the gang team up with a master thief to catch an underworld criminal who hired her to steal a dirty bomb.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: When MacGyver takes Riley and Bozer into the wilderness for survival training, things take a turn when they run into a violent group of criminals; Jack and Matty go on a road trip to place Matty's ex-husband and his family in witness protection.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After construction workers find an archbishop's body with the kneecaps surgically removed, the team returns to the case of the Widow's Son serial killer.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Three days before Christmas the body of a bearded man in a tailor-made Santa outfit turns up in a sewer; Brennan visits her father in prison and plots a nontraditional holiday reunion.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the remains of a professional motorcycle racer are found in a hot spring, the team suspects his rival to be the murderer; Dr. Lance Sweets forces Booth and Brennan to accompany him on a double date.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the college-basketball world to determine who is responsible for the murder of a player on a nationally ranked team.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After a woman's car is run off the road, only her baby survives; Booth and Brennan go to the woman's hometown to investigate.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Max (Ryan O'Neal) goes on trial for the murder of FBI Deputy Director Robert Kirby, all the team members but Brennan are called as expert witnesses for the prosecution.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: An aspiring singer (Ace Young) is murdered and, as Brennan and Booth investigate the musician's fans and foes, one obsessed woman transfers her affections to Booth.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A human jawbone found at the Jeffersonian alerts Brennan and the team that the Gormogon serial killer has struck again; a lab explosion lands Zack in the hospital; Gormogon's silver skeleton disappears from the vault.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Brennan and Booth go to London to guest-lecture at Oxford and Scotland Yard, local officials ask them to help investigate the murder of a young heiress; Angela's long-estranged husband returns.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new Forensic Pathologist Kam Karimore are drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching as they seek to identify the villain.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Chumley from "Pawn Stars" comes into the shop with a 1950s Murray pedal car and a specific vision for how he wants it restored; the crew works to fix up a 1965 Honda Superhawk that hasn't run since the 1980s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An 1881 potbelly stove whips into the shop; the guys are challenged to restore a 1940s children's Irish mail cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Tyler and Brettly volunteer to tow in a 1947 railroad speeder; a client brings in a NYC police call box.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: At Wheels Through Time, Dale is charged with bringing a mysterious, 104-year-old motorcycle back to life; Steve's Restorations deals with a rare vintage arm-wrestling arcade game from the 1980s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick agrees to restore a vintage Italian bumper car from a local antique shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A late 1800s Penny Farthing bicycle is delivered to the shop needing a major restoration; Rick implements an employee of the month award; the guys work on a 1930s parlour stove.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The Ghouls install the HEMI in the sea foam turquoise RoadRunner. The dash is installed in Torino’s GTX and Stan Lynch comes calling.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The 1-of-1 ever built, 1969 Hemi Road Runner convertible returns to the lift; the ghouls scramble to finish work on the vehicle before the owner arrives.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The Ghouls test drive Torino’s GTX. Royal and Dave do some detailing and a devilish plan is hatched to fool Mark.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It seems every time Danny finds a project for the shop, he winds up keeping it.

programme.desc: Ziggy Marley meets Danny at Vamp'd to commission a restoration on his father, Bob Marley's, vintage Mercedes.

programme.desc: When Danny is asked to create a commemorative bike that honors music legend Les Paul he has to pull out all the stops.

programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Shannon honor fallen troops with a custom patriotic motorcycle. Later, Danny and Kevin push the limit to acquire a `71 Monte Carlo, and then have a tough decision.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Two brothers want to surprise their dad with the ultimate car guy gift.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the Count's Kustoms crew rally together to help Shannon restore his father's long lost chopper. Meanwhile, Danny does a do-over on his customized 1990 Chevy Suburban.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the World Series of Poker guys want a Count's Kustoms chopper as the ultimate online giveaway, Danny is determined to make it something special.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is so proud of the van he restored as a gift for his bandmate John Zito, that he decides to give his own classic van a make-over.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: An eccentric couple wants to turn a 20 year-old ambulance into a ghost-hunting vehicle, which awakens a rogue spirit in the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin disapproves of how much money Danny is spending tricking out his dream FMC Motorhome, but Danny has a surprise plan to help him get over it.

programme.desc: Rock Legend Alice Cooper left his prized Avanti in The Count's hands, and now, he's back to get it! Will Alice like what Danny and the crew have done?

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the logging season winds to a close, the drama heats up. Conner fights off defeat, while the men of Pihl fight each other.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: From mountaintop to river's bottom, six crews will take on one of America's deadliest jobs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the summer heats up, so do the men of the mountain. Rygaard breaks in its greenhorns, while Jay Browning takes a gamble on a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: After an ill-fated road trip, Jimmy and James Smith arrive in Florida to tackle the dangerous black water of the American South, only to realize they're in way over their heads.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The forest fights back as a careless mistake at Browning threatens to take out DJ and Cody. At Rygaard, Gabe gives his greenhorns an ultimatum.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Logging country is under siege. Melvin's gung-ho attitude puts the crew in danger. Rygaard's greenhorns fight for a permanent spot on the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the logging season hits the rails. Jay Browning battles allergic shock, while Gabe Rygaard sends one of the greenhorns packing.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, one of the greenhorns goes AWOL, and Gabe has him on the chopping block. But he's not the only one; several loggers face the ax.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers struggle to get back on track after losing a man. At Browning, a weak cable threatens to kill half the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby's desperate dash for cash is halted when he crashes in the swamp. A monster gator stalks the S&S boys, pushing Jimmy to his breaking point.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy and James come face-to-face with the 12-foot gator that has stalked them for weeks. In the swamps of Louisiana, Shelby goes solo on a challenging mission.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi wakes up on the wrong side of the bed but makes the best of it in Fullerton; Ivy snipes one locker and grabs a second, knocking out the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry arrives code 3 to Stanton, where he takes on a new disciple; Lisa gets clinical with her find, forcing her to take a closer look; the new guy pays heavily for a unit, but seems to know what he's doing, while Brandi and Rene struggle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers manage to make a charitable contribution in the neighborhood of North Long Beach; Darrell and Dave wager on who got the better sister locker; Brandi and Jarrod spend way too much, but see their treasure soar.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Victorville, a friendly duel runs Dusty up, but his vinyl might save him; Ivy's locker shines some light on the business; Lisa learns that she needs her locker about as much as she needs a hole in her head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene shows up in Orange, declaring himself the king, while Dusty isn't quite ready to concede the title; Kenny accidentally reinvents the wheel; Lisa sees things from a slightly different perspective.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has to deal with Kimber's eyes on a competitor; Ivy brings a full truck, hoping for a second haul; Dusty unpacks what could be the ultimate assistant; Rene's hunch serves him well, putting together one of his greatest profits.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy changes his game and pursues a locker with collectibles; Mary looks for quick-sale items; Darrell calls upon a friend for assistance when he is tested by local Mission Hills buyers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The sun beats down in Oceanside, Calif., bringing out all the parasols; Dusty and Lupe steal a no-brainer locker, which pays off handsomely; Darrell taxes himself, and it almost puts him in storage jail; Brandi and Lisa find their true identities.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod pick up what may be the best of the worst in Buena Park, Calif.; Kenny and his cousin glide through a half-decent locker; Ivy comes to the auction dressed to kill; Mary tries to turn up the volume.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is determined to actually win a locker for once in Santa Ana and has to show restraint to do it; Rene spots a stack of items in a locker that speaks to him; Kenny puts his needs out to the universe; Barry struggles to stay in the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello can't wait to see what he can drum up this time around; Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it; Kenny does his best to fire up his profits; Brandi can't see the potential in the units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A confident Kenny has a three-step plan for success in Stanton, Calif.; Darrell helps Kimber find winning items for her new boutique; Rene brings Casey, who needs a distraction; Laura takes lead as auctioneer, while Dan holds the clipboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene gets lukewarm results bobbing for profits in Stanton; Dusty finds a hoard of quality equipment, inking himself a decent payday; looking for treasure, Brandi ends up with the green in an unexpected manner.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy takes on a supervisory role in Stanton, and it leads him to a bit of Slavic success; Brandi tries to help Danielle outfit her new apartment; Lisa gambles on a painting.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Back in Montebello, Gunter comes along to help Rene, who won't give him the time of day; Darrell tries to make Kimber his queen; Ivy and his boys Rochambeau their way to solid showing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy and Pops shop for bags in Fullerton but end up with containers; Darrell and Kimber go all in on a toy locker, while Brandi covers her costs in an otherwise unassuming household unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa returns to Moreno Valley, where it all started, and gets nostalgic with her locker; Kenny welcomes a new granddaughter to the clan and would love to find an appropriate unit; Dusty and Lupe put a little elbow grease into their purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: On an uncharacteristically wet day in Montebello, King Darrell is on a mission to defend his throne; Rene and Casey signal their intentions to undermine his plans; Kenny gets bowled over by his locker; Lisa manages to rope herself something decent.

programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For Dog and Beth it's not only another day in paradise, it's their anniversary. Beth is hoping for a romantic dinner with her man, but she knows only too well that for Dog work always comes first.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy and today he's proving it. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the local cops put out an APB for a client with a checked past, Dog springs into action. With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For Dog and Beth it's not only another day in paradise, it's their anniversary. Beth is hoping for a romantic dinner with her man, but she knows only too well that for Dog work always comes first.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel. But sometimes the defendant is a threat to the community and the cosigner asks the bondsman for protection.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive's sketchy associates and footloose ways spell trouble for Dog in today's hunt.

programme.desc: This fugitive's sketchy associates and footloose ways spell trouble for Dog in today's hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive named Wayne by tricking him. Dog calls Wayne to tell him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has a full plate of fugitives in Kona, and the whole family heads to the Big Island to help. They capture Clifford, who has a nasty habit of hitting his wife.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to the earliest Tibetan traditions, Shambhala, the kingdom of the gods, is hidden high in the Himalaya Mountains; examining if it's possible that this mystical realm truly exists.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious symbol of the keyhole exists in mystic texts, sacred architecture and ancient artwork found all over the planet; exploring if this cryptic shape represents a profound connection to the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A multitude of guests and scientists explores everything from human origins to groundbreaking archaeological finds, new understandings of the cosmos, and the profound possibility that humans are not alone in the universe.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1587, a group of settlers land off the coast of North Carolina on Roanoke Island to establish the first English Colony in America; a few years later, the 115 men, women and children vanish without a trace, leaving only cryptic clues.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1997, thousands of people across Phoenix witness a series of strange lights unlike anything they've ever seen; many think this could be one of the largest-scale UFO sightings in history, but there may be another explanation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: An ancient mechanical device found on a 2,000-year-old shipwreck has become known as the world's first computer; the machine is centuries more advanced than historians thought possible, but its origin and true purpose are shrouded in secrecy.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite centuries of sightings and searches, one deep-sea monster remains unidentified; as evidence continues to mount, the mystery endures as to whether the Loch Ness monster exists.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Awe-inspiring and mysterious, the pyramids of Egypt are significant wonders of the ancient world; more than 4,000 years old, they are celebrated architectural marvels, but no one fully understands how they were built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1969, a serial killer taunts investigators with cryptic ciphers, leaving police and the public questioning his identity for over 50 years; new evidence and technology may finally be able to crack his code and discover who the Zodiac Killer is.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On November 22, 1963, President John F Kennedy is assassinated, shaking the nation to its core; while an initial suspect is captured, many believe there's more to the story; investigators and amateur sleuths alike have been searching for answers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Nestled within a remote valley in Utah is a ranch that some believe is a hotbed of strange, inexplicable phenomena including terrifying creatures, paranormal apparitions and lights in the sky.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: From Egypt to Easter Island, towering figures built by ancient man stand watch over the Earth; are these stone giants simply a testament to humanity's past or could they depict visitors from another world? Experts seek the answers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In numerous ancient cultures throughout the world, stories were told of ancestors that came to Earth from the Pleiades star cluster, but could new scientific findings reveal that humankind's true origins lie not on Earth but 400 light years away.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Chilean government questions whether new footage from a Navy helicopter indicates a connection to geoglyphs in the Atacama Desert.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Accounts of creatures that can shape shift from one form into another can be found, but could similarities between the ancient stories and modern-day alien abduction accounts reveal that shape shifters are real and have come to Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Shocking new evidence reveals that advanced civilizations might have existed on Earth tens of thousands of years ago; is it possible that a technologically advanced society thrived on Earth, and did they leave behind a record.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the Mojave Desert, there is a structure built to bestow everlasting life and according to the architect, the blueprint was provided by an extraterrestrial visitor known as the Integratron, could it actually provide the key to immortality.
